result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: FOP Order Staying Proceedings
Proposed FOP Order staying proceedings
Notice of Case Acceptance to First Offender Program
Status conference on August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ml] Case called at 8:34PM
Defendant Amaya M. Leonard in court with attorney Theodore R Rolfs. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Att Rolfs advises that the Defendant missed her FOP intake appointment, however another one has been scheduled. Att Rolfs requests that another Status Conference be scheduled. The State does not object, advises that it will be requesting this file proceed to trial at the next hearing.

The Court impresses the importance of making the FOP appointments.

recess 8:36AM

NEXT: Status Conference on 08/08 at 8:30AM with in person appearances
Status conference on June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] case called at 10:03am 
Defendant Amaya M. Leonard in court with Attorney Theodore Rolfs. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rolfs indicates that the State has extended an offer for Ms. Leonard to get into the First Offender Program. She has an appointment scheduled with the FOP staffperson on May 2nd.
recess 10:05am
[off record: in response to the clerk's inquiry, Ms. Leonard indicates that the 1153 Boughton Street, Apt.19C address remains current] 

NEXT:  Status Conference on June 7th at 8:30am (this hearing will be removed from the Court's calendar if verification of FOP admission is received before this hearing date)

records.addlTxt: Atty. Rolfs
Order to Seal Victim Key
Scheduling Order

Pre-trial conference on February 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on March 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Conditions of this bond include:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Victim 1 or Witness 1 as to referred to in the Criminal Complaint and the Victim/Witness Key

[ml] Case called at 1:33PM
Defendant Amaya M. Leonard appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient by counsel agreement. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Pleas of "Not Guilty" are entered; speedy trial is waived by the Defendant.

The Court requires a $500.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Victim 1 or Witness 1 as to referred to in the Criminal Complaint and the Victim/Witness Key

recess 1:38PM

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 02/16 at 9:00AM with counsel appearances only  (2) Status Conference on 03/03 at 3:00PM with in person appearances
